task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 34°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to look up to see the full height of the building from ground to roof, as the current pitch is level and doesn't capture the top of the structure.
I am currently looking up at the building but need to adjust my pitch further to capture the full height from base to roof, as the current view may still be missing the top or bottom.

I am still looking up at 30° pitch, but to estimate the full height accurately, I need to tilt further upward to ensure the roofline is fully visible and then adjust downward to see the base for comparison.
I have been rotating upward repeatedly but may not be aligned with the building’s true vertical axis; I should now look down to establish the ground level for height reference before estimating.
I am currently looking far down at the ground; I need to adjust my pitch upward to reacquire the building’s full vertical profile from base to roof for accurate height estimation.

I am now looking up at 60° and likely seeing the top of the building; I need to look down slightly to capture the base and estimate height by visual proportion relative to known objects or ground distance.
I am now looking downward and likely seeing the base of the building; I should look up again to capture the full vertical span from ground to roof for height estimation.

I have now captured both the top and bottom of the building through pitch adjustments; using the known distance of 10.6m to the building and visual angle span, I estimate the height to be approximately 24 meters.
